post_body: What to do early morning as a tourist?

comment.body: If your plane arrives at 7, you won't be in town before 8. Go to you hotel and drop off luggage. Cafe Richard is in the immediate vicinity of the Dom and you could start there with a nice breakfast. The Dom itself is open early so you can check that out before or after breakfast. Most other museums open around 10. If your hotel is a bit more out of the way, drop your luggage at the main station, it's also immediately by the Dom.
Many bakeries are open early in the morning. You can have breakfast there
What day of the week will you arrive?
Have a breakfast-Kölsch in a pub that's still open from the night before.

You could check out Cafe Extrablatt (there are several in the city), they offer buffet style breakfast every day of the week. Other than that, yes, there are nice museums all around, mostly art and history related.
Tuesday. Our planned activities start from Wednesday due to the long travel hours
We will - we try to avoid places that are too crowded. Most of our destinations are the nature reserves for some photography and historic buildings
Please don't. Extrablatt is German Olive Garden
Yes, Extrablatt is generic chain but it’s a perfectly fine place to just chill. They have a large menu and large locations(usually) so you won’t be waiting long for a table

Plenty of museums open at 10 am. Wallraf, Roman-Germanic, NS-Dokumentationszentrum just to name a few.

Until then you could look for bakeries, they open pretty early. I like épi
Thank you, that would be a nice way to spend the day
The Roman-Germanic museum is very good and interesting. It is very near the cathedrale of Cologne. Opposite of this museum is a well known local pub. The museum is also near all types of shops.
The museum was moved to the house of Belgium due to renovations to the Roman-Germanic museum, at least as of late November that was the case
The RGM is currently closed due to renovations.
